meanings.definition: A relief printing technique in which an image is carved into a block of wood.
meanings.sent1: The artist carved a beautiful design into the woodblock.
meanings.sent2: The printer used the woodblock to create multiple copies of the artwork.
meanings.sent3: When the woodblock slipped, the print turned out all wobbly!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was a woodblock, each idea etched deeply into her mind.
meanings.sent5: The woodblock bore the intricate details of the forest scene.

meanings.definition: A block of wood used for relief printing.
meanings.sent1: The woodblock was carefully inked before pressing it onto paper.
meanings.sent2: He bought a new woodblock to add to his collection of printing tools.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the woodblock for a nut and tried to bury it!
meanings.sent4: The woodblock stood out among the tools, a silent artist waiting to create.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh wood filled the room as the woodblock was sanded smooth.

meanings.definition: To create an image using a woodblock.
meanings.sent1: She carefully woodblock-printed her own greeting cards.
meanings.sent2: The students learned how to woodblock during art class.
meanings.sent3: He decided to woodblock a picture of his pet cat wearing a crown.
meanings.sent4: Her memories woodblock-printed in her mind, each one clear and vivid.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands moved swiftly, bringing the woodblock image to life on paper.
